ETYMOLOGY: From Old English discipul (via Old French disciple), from Latin discipulus 'learner, pupil', from discere 'to learn'.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun). Countable nouns can be counted and have singular and plural forms.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A personal follower of a teacher or leader; a student who accepts and assists in spreading the doctrine of another.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 某位老师或领袖的个人追随者；接受并协助传播他人学说的学生、门徒。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: As a young man, he became a devoted disciple of the famous Zen master.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他年轻时成了那位著名禅宗大师的虔诚信徒。

REGISTER: Neutral; often used in religious, philosophical, or academic contexts.
